result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoriano Carbo Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked the defendant has 103 days credit for time served.  Defendant to report to Probation and Parole upon release if they have not contacted him before his release.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.
Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin 09/01/2022

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request,  Defendant shall undergo a Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant shall have no contact with any minor females without direct written approval by his Agent, exception would be his own daughter M.C.  Defendant needs approval of his agent before engaging in any romantic relationship    The defendant shall have no contact with the Victim LYAM  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victoriano Carbo Torres

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rachel Pisors
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:47 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Victoriano Carbo Torres appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter.  Victim appeared by video    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Seeking a Public Defender, he got paperwork and he filled it out and sent it.  Went over charges with the defendant, defendant wants the preliminary hearing.  Victim wanted to speak, State says victim is only 15 and needs a parent to represent her, no parent available so was not allowed to speak.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with  LYAM, her family or her residence of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.   No contact with anyone under the age of 18, unless supervised by sight and sound.
